personalInfo.name: Ujjwal Vishwakarma
personalInfo.tagline: Building the future through code and innovation
personalInfo.about: I'm always excited to work on new projects and collaborate with amazing people. Let's create something great together!

hero.description: Pre-final year student at IIT Jammu with 2.5+ years of programming experience. Worked with C++, Python, and Rust. I solve DSA problems, build personal and curriculum projects, and have a strong interest in Deep Learning. I've studied research papers and completed François Chollet's Deep Learning book.

socialProfiles.name: GitHub
socialProfiles.description: My code repositories and open source contributions

projects.title: Multi-threaded Ray Tracer
projects.description: A multi-threaded ray tracer based on the first book in Ray Tracing in One Weekend series.
projects.details: Developed a CPU based multi-threaded ray tracer in C++17 to output images in .ppm file format. Implemented features like anti-aliasing, diffuse materials, metal materials, dielectric materials, and multi-threading for performance optimization.

projects.title: Semantic Image Retrieval Engine
projects.description: A semantic image searching tool for retrieving images based on textual descriptions or semantically similar images.
projects.details: Built a semantic image retrieval engine using OpenAI's CLIP model for encoding images and text, and Meta's Segment Anything Model (SAM) for image segmentation. Implemented a FastAPI backend with FAISS for efficient similarity search.

projects.title: Document Identity Aggregator
projects.description: Created a system to aggregate and verify CV data using web crawling, OCR and NLP to detect inconsistencies and validate authenticity.
projects.details: Developed a system to aggregate and cross-verify candidate CV data from multiple online sources to detect inconsistencies and validate authenticity.

projects.title: Deep Learning with Python Projects
projects.description: Practicing Deep Learning from François Chollet's book along with research-inspired experiments using TensorFlow and Keras.
projects.details: Following the "Deep Learning with Python" by François Chollet book with additional research-inspired experiments and implementations.

projects.title: Spotify to YT Music Playlist Transfer
projects.description: Transferred a playlist of songs from Spotify to YouTube Music with a user-friendly GUI.
projects.details: Built a desktop application to seamlessly transfer playlists between Spotify and YouTube Music using their respective APIs.

projects.title: Portfolio Website
projects.description: A modern, responsive portfolio website built with React and Framer Motion showcasing my work and skills.
projects.details: Personal portfolio website featuring responsive design, smooth animations, dark/light theme toggle, and optimized performance.

projects.title: Delhi Metro Ticket Booking System
projects.description: A web application for booking Delhi Metro tickets with user authentication and real-time seat availability.
projects.details: Developed as a database management systems course's term project, this web app allows users to book Delhi Metro tickets with features like user authentication, live-logging and real-time seat availability.

academic.description: Specialized in software engineering, data structures, algorithms, discrete mathematics, programming languages, operating systems, database management systems, computer networks, artificial intelligence and computer vision. Simultaneously participated in various hackathons and coding competitions, enhancing practical skills in software development.
achievements: Won INT MAESTRO at Anhad'25 at IIT JAMMU
Showed leadership skills while being Class Representative
Won third place in Line Follower Robot competition at Anhad'24

academic.description: Focused on advanced mathematics topics including calculus, algebra, and statistics.

articles.title: A view on Technological Growth Patterns
articles.excerpt: Observing patterns in nature is a common human tendency, and I’m sure you have felt this at various times. One day, I found myself pondering a question: How does something grow? Does it follow a specific pattern, perhaps a curve? After reflecting on this for a few minutes, I recalled a lesson from my chemistry class where we studied a graph representing growth. It illustrated how something reaches a saturation point beyond which it cannot exceed a certain limit. This made me wonder:...
